text: John Hilton Edwards (26 March 1928 â€“ 11 October 2007) was a British medical geneticist. Edwards reported the first description of a syndrome of multiple congenital malformations caused by the presence of an extra chromosome. In 1979, Edwards was elected to fellowship of the Royal Society. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2007 deaths Category:British geneticists
title: John H. Edwards
